direction.raw_text: :  a mixture of headlines, newsreel footage and live action. Economy Booming ! Postwar Optimism ! L.A.: City of the Future !  But most prominent among them: GANGLAND !  Police photographers document crime scenes. The meat wagon hauls ex-button men to the morgue.  Where will it end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A. SKYLINE - SUNSET Palm trees in silhouette against a cherry sky.  City lights twinkle.  Los Angeles.  A place where anything is possible.  A place where dreams come true.  As the sky darkens, triple-kleig lights begin to sweep back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The KLEIG LIGHTS are out front.  Valets hurry to park a line of elegant cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the future of Los Angeles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAYOR yanks a cloth to reveal a MODEL of L.A. criss- crossed by an elaborate FREEWAY SYSTEM.  The CROWD oohs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: claps.  A SOCIETY MATRON nods her approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tuxedoed, watches off to one side. A behind-the-scenes power broker, Patchett exudes authority much more so than the Mayor does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Arroyo Seco freeway is just the beginning.  We're planning freeways from Downtown to Santa Monica, from the South Bay to the San Fernando Valley.  Twenty minutes to work or play is the longest you'll have to travel. More applause.  One REPORTER asks a little too loudly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many bodies you think Mickey Cohen'll be able to hide in all that cement? The Mayor wears a plastic smile, ignores it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pops snapshots, but the real action is on the floor where MICKEY COHEN does a wicked "Lindy Hop" with THREE different GIRLS at once.  A fireplug of a man, he hardly seems a public menace.  Nearby is his bodyguard JOHNNY STOMPANATO.  Over it all:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meyer Harris Cohen, Mickey C to his fans.  He's the big moocher, local L.A. color to the nth degree.  You know Mickey.  He runs dope, rackets and prostitution. He kills a dozen people a year. But who you may not know is bodyguard Johnny Stompanato. His hair in a slick pompadour, Stompanato keeps an eye on Cohen and comes onto a CIGARETTE GIRL at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johnny's handsome, ladies, but the real attraction is below the belt. Second only to Steve Cochran, he's sometimes known as 'Oscar' because of his Academy Award-size appendage. Mickey works a sweat on the dance floor.  A bottle of champagne pops; Stompanato reacts, nearly draws a pistol from his shoulder holster.  As he laughs at himself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lurid page one headlines cover the wall where SID HUDGEONS types.  The essence of sleaze, Sid is the publisher-photographer-writer of Hush-Hush magazine and keeper of inside dirt supreme.  As he continues...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember, dear readers, you heard it here first, off the record, on the Q.T. and very Hush-Hush .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The party continues.  The Mayor has moved off to the side with the power brokers.  Patchett is a presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're selling an image, gentlemen. Beautiful weather.  Affordable housing. (re:  model) Trouble-free transportation.  And the best police department in the world to keep it all running smoothly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dozen people watch a display windoe TELEVISION as it rolls the opening of the hit show "Badge of Honor."  Over familiar THEME MUSIC, "Sgt. Joe Reno" (actor BRETT CHASE) walks the streets of Los Angeles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name?  Joe Reno.  The city? Los Angeles.  A big town.  Full of all sorts of people.  It's my job to help them.  I like what I do. I'm a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mayor continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But with a second rate Al Capone out there, L.A. looks like Chicago in the '30s.  Something has to be done. As Pierce Patchett nods sagely.

direction.raw_text: Wrestler GORGEOUS GEORGE primps and poses before flatten- ing an opponent with a drop kick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An enthusiastic crowd adjusts their 3-D glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In monogrammed silk pajamas, Mickey Cohen answers the door, his pet BULLDOG Mickey Jr. at his feet.  The police are waiting.  REPORTERS' flashbulbs pop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Cohen, you're under arrest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.  What's the charge?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets his hand prints in the sidewalk.

direction.raw_text: hurry to finish the harvest.  We PAN TO CONSTRUCTION WORKERS who wait impatiently with bull- dozers under a "Spirit of the Future" BANNER.  As the last picker leaves the field, the bulldozers move in, leveling the bean rows to make way for a housing tract.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flashbulbs pop as Mickey Cohen exits and starts down the steps.  Accompanied by his LAWYERS, bodyguard Stompanato and mob lieutenants DEUCE PERKINS and NATE JANKLOW, Cohen ignores REPORTERS' shouts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's your bullshit now, Mickey?! As Cohen gets into a waiting car, the media turn their attention to District Attorney ELLIS LOEW.  A singularly ambitious man, Loew loves the spotlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today is an auspicious one for the city of Los Angeles.  Mickey Cohen has just been sentenced to ten years in federal prison for failure to pay income tax. As the District Attorney for Los Angeles County, it is my pleasure to declare our great city organized crime free.  It is truly the dawning of a new day. The SONG ENDS and so does the MONTAGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: December 24th.  Wendell "BUD" WHITE, 30, stares at the enormous Christmas tree on the deco platform over Bullocks' entrance.  An LAPD cop, Bud's rep as the toughest man on the force has been well earned.  In the back seat, with cases of Walker Black and Cutty Sark, is Bud's partner -- DICK STENSLAND.  Older, but also a tough hump, "Stens" sucks on a pint of Old Crow. The passenger door opens and Mickey Cohen bodyguard Johnny Stompanato slides in.  Guinea handsome, Johnny wears his curls in a tight pompadour.  With his boss behind bars, he's out of work.  Bud just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer White.  I heard you got a hard-on for wife beaters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you fuck people up for a living.  That don't make me you. Capisce , shitbird? Stompanato smiles.  Nervous.  Through the window, Bud watches a Salvation Army Santa palm coins from a kettle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud ain't in the mood for small talk, Stompanato.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Mickey C's doing time and half the other guys who'd hire me are dead or left town.  I need money.  If your snitch-fund's green, I'll get you some fucking-A collars. Impatient, Bud tugs at a finger, CRACKS a KNUCKLE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's this guy.  He's blond and fat, about forty.  Likes the ponies.  Been pimping his wife to cover his losses.  Knocks her around to keep her in line. Bud's eyes narrow at this last bit of info.  Stompanato holds up a slip of paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figure the address is worth twenty. Bud digs into his wallet, pulls out twenty bucks, exchanges it with Stompanato.  Stompanato smiles smugly, grabs a bottle of Scotch from the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yuletide cheer, fellas. Without warning, Bud grabs Stompanato's tie and yanks, slamming his forehead into the dash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happy New Year, greaseball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stucco job in a row of vet prefabs.  A neon Santa sleigh has landed on the roof.  Through the front window, we see a fat guy browbeating a woman.  Puff-faced, 35- ish, she backs away as he rages at her. The Packard pulls up out front.  Stensland could care less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave it for later, Bud.  We got to pick up the rest of the booze and get back to the precinct. Bud KILLS the IGNITION, picks up the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Central, this is 4A-31.  Send a prowler to 1486 Evergreen.  White male in custody.  Code 623 point one.  Domestic assault and battery.  I won't be here, but they'll see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: steps to the house.  Inside, we hear SLAPS, MUFFLED CRIES.  Bud grips an outlet cord coming off the roof and yanks.  The sleigh crashes to the ground with REINDEER EXPLODING around it.  A beat.  The fat guy runs out to investigate, trips over Rudolph. Bud pounces.  Fat guy takes a swing, misses.  Grabbing fat guy's hair, Bud smashes his face to the pavement. Once, twice.  Teeth skitter down the walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Touch her again and I'll know about it.  Understand?  Huh? Another face full of gravel.  Fat guy's WIFE watches with apprehension from the steps as Bud cuffs her husband's hands behind his back, empties his pockets.  A cash roll and car keys.  Bud looks over at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got someplace you can go? She nods.  Bud hands her the keys and the cash.

direction.raw_text: Go get yourself fixed up.

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas, huh? Bud watches as she gets into a pre-war Ford in the drive. She backs over a blinking reindeer as she goes.

direction.raw_text: You and women, partner.  What's next?  Kids and dogs?

direction.raw_text: The "Badge of Honor" set.  A Christmas party in full swing.  Eating, drinking, and dancing.  Star Brett Chase, seen earlier on television, is holding court.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sgt. "Trashcan" JACK VINCENNES, late 30s with slick, good looks, dances with a young ACTRESS.  Grinding their way through a ballad, they're obviously hitting it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brett Chase told me you're the cop who busted Bob Mitchum. (grinds closer) These 'Badge of Honor' guys like to pretend, but being the real thing must be a thrill.

direction.raw_text: Let's go someplace quiet.  I'll give you the low-down on Mitchum.

direction.raw_text: I'll get my coat. They're interrupted by Sid Hudgeons.

direction.raw_text: Beats me.  Look, Jackie-Boy, a friend of mine just sold some reefer to Matt Reynolds.  He's tripping the light fantastic with Tammy Jordan at 2245 Maravilla, Hollywood Hills.  It's right around the corner.

direction.raw_text: Contract players at Metro.  You pinch 'em.  I do you up feature in the next issue.  Plus the usual fifty cash.  Tell me, am I fucking Santa Claus?

direction.raw_text: I need an extra fifty.  Two patrolmen at twenty apiece and a dime for the watch commander at Hollywood Station.

direction.raw_text: Jack!  It's Christmas!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  It's felony possession of marijuana.

direction.raw_text: a VIEW of Grauman's Chinese.  Jack and two uniformed patrolmen wait on the darkened street.  An arc light has been set up.  Hudgeons creeps back over from the house.

direction.raw_text: They're sitting in the dark, goofing on the Christmas tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand there with your camera. I'll stop here so you get Grauman's Chinese in the backgrouns.

direction.raw_text: I like it!  I like it!

direction.raw_text: It's Christmas morning in the City of Angels, and while decent citizens sleep the sleep of the righteous, hopheads prowl for marijuana, not knowing that a man is coming to stop them.  The free- wheeling, big-time Big V, celebrity crime-stopper, Jack Vincennes, the scourge of grasshoppers and junk fiends everywhere.  You like it, Jackie- Boy?

direction.raw_text: Suspects, mostly drunk and disorderly, are ushered through.  Sgt. ED EXLEY, 30, bespectacled, is at the desk with a YOUNG OFFICER.  Exley is an up-and-comer.  Burning with ambition.  The faster he rises through the ranks, the more resentment he leaves in his wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's on the call sheet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A guy dressed as Santa has been exposing himself to kids in Los Feliz.  Apparently, sir, he's decorated himself.

direction.raw_text: With tinsel and plastic icicles and... on his penis, sir.

direction.raw_text: I get the idea.  You got a description?

direction.raw_text: Of his penis, sir?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A case each of gin, Scotch, and rum.  Everything top shelf.  None of that watered-down stuff you push on Errol Flynn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like a helluva party. Her hair kerchiefed, Lynn waits as the Owner writes it up.  There's glamour, a cat-girl grace about Lynn.  She seems like she belongs up on the wall with the movie stars.  Lynn looks across as Bud White heads toward the counter.  Spotting her, Bud doesn't look so tough for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want it delivered?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before five tomorrow. The Owner spots Bud.  A big smile turns to a frown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right with you, Lynn. The Owner begins indiscriminately loading hard liquor into a cardboard box, leaving Bud and Lynn to look at each other.  Bud says the only thing he can think of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merry Christmas yourself, Officer .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That obvious, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's practically stamped on your forehead. As the Owner bangs a case of liquor on the counter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud exits with his booze, heads for the car.  Something catches his eye.  A woman in the rear passenger seat of a new Cadillac.  SUSAN LEFFERTS.  Both her eyes are black. Bud starts over.  The case on his hip, he motions for her to roll down the window.  The driver's side door opens and bodyguard TURNER "BUZZ" MEEKS menaces his way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get lost why don't you? Meeks stops short as Bud shoves his badge in Meeks' face. Setting the case on the car's hood, Bud spins Meeks around, pats him down.  He finds a .38 in a shoulder holster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a license for that. Bud removes Meeks' wallet, checks the ID.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut me some slack.  I used to be a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turner Meeks?  Never heard of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just call him Buzz. Bud raps on Susan's window with his badge.  It comes down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Beside her, a man leans over.  Pierce Patchett, seen before at the freeway unveiling, is a man used to being chauffeured.  Like FDR, he smokes his cigarette in a holder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not asking you. Patchett has no idea he's walking on thin ice.  As he stares impatiently at Bud, Bud looks back to Susan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody hit you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not what you think. Bud looks to see Lynn Bracken moving to the driver's door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got the wrong idea, Mister. I'm fine. Susan laughs.  Patchett eases back into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's nice to know you care. Bud considers Meeks' gun license, then hands him back the .38 and wallet.  Lifting his booze, Bud watches Meeks get back in the car. Stensland steps up as the cabbie starts to pull away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on? For an odd moment, Stensland and Meeks lock eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seen him around.  He used to be a cop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty, handsome in his police captain's uniform.  Singing "Silver Bells" in a beautiful low tenor.  Tough, respected, Dudley goes to bed as a cop every night of his life.  He's a department power to be reckoned with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An L.A. Herald Express REPORTER and photographer listen along with the gathered patrolmen as Dudley finishes to applause.  Dudley joins the press.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain Smith, I -- DUDLEY Drop the formalities; it's Christmas Eve.  Call me Dudley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley, I came up with a title for the story.  I'm calling it "Silent Night with the L.A.P.D."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent.  How's this? (dramatic pause) The sanctity of the night is an invitation to the darker criminal element.  Our vigilance will not be diminished. As the Reporter scribbles down the quote...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Smith with an S. They laugh.  Dudley points the way out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way, gentlemen. Dudley's the last one out the door.  As he goes, he turns back to give the men a wink.  He's no sooner out the door when the first case of Johnny Walker is brought in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed Exley gets another report from the Young Officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two police officers were assaulted in a bar.  Brown and Helenowski. He hands the report to Exley.  It's now that Dudley comes through on his press junket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Sergeant Ed Exley.  Son of the legendary Preston Exley.  He's the watch commander tonight and a damn fine job. As the photographer snaps Exley's picture...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was fortunate enough to be partnered with his father when I was a rookie.  It makes a man feel old.  That's a fact. (a beat) Feel free to get a feel for the place. As the Reporter and photographer wander off, Dudley turns to Exley a bit more serious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A word with you, lad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley pours two drinks, hands one to Exley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the memory of your father. They drink.  Exley looks to a photo on the wall. Himself as a ten-year-old standing between Dudley and his father Preston, both in police uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The day he got the Medal of Valor. A simpler time. Remembering, Exley invokes his father's favorite toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the solving of crimes that require absolute justice. Exley raises his glass, but Dudley just watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was his favorite toast. (a beat) I saw the test results on the lieutenant's exam.  You placed first out of twenty-three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The youngest applicant by eight years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll make lieutenant inside a year.  Patrol division?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking Detective Bureau. We can see Dudley doesn't approve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have the eye for human weakness to be a good detective. Or the stomach.  You're a political animal, Edmund. The criticism stings, but Dudley's a straight shooter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I...?  Would you be willing to plant corroborative evidence on a suspect you knew was guilty in order to ensure an indictment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley, we've been over this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Answer yes or no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be willing to rig crime scene evidence to support a prosecuting attorney's working hypothesis...?  Yes or no, Edmund.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be willing to beat confessions out of suspects you knew to be guilty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be willing to shoot hardened criminals in the back to offset the chance -- EXLEY No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then for God's sake, don't be a detective.  Stick to assignments where you won't have to make those choices.  Patrol, Internal Affairs, but not the Bureau.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you mean well, Dudley, but I don't need to do it the way you did.  Or my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least get rid of the glasses. I can't think of one Bureau man who wears them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Head saps.  The kid drops to his knees drooling blood. Bud grabs Stensland, hauls him off of Garcia who looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you, pendejo .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And fuck your mother too. Bud sees red.  Letting go of Stensland, Bud White picks up Garcia by the neck.  There are cheers, "Attaboys" and "Holy Fucks" as Bud bangs Garcia's head on the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop, Officer!  That's an order! Cops block Exley's way.  As Bud looks over, Garcia kicks him in the balls.  A dangling shot.  Bud keels into the bars, Garcia stumbles out of the cell, smack into Jack. Jack looks down aghast at blood on his cashmere blazer, then puts Garcia down with a left-right. Exley pulls a pad of paper and pen form his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going in my report!  All of you! Exley has just started taking names when Bud grabs him by the scruff of the neck and hauls him off balance into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Exley struggles, a cop opens the door to the store room.  Bud slings Exley inside, then slams the door tight.  Exley is locked in.  As Bud moves off, we hear
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me out!  That's an order!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Herald Reporter and photographer enter unchaperoned and unnoticed.  Stensland swings like a madman.  That's when a flashbulb goes off.  Freezing everyone in black and white.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CHIEF sits behind a desk in a four-star uniform. Dudley Smith sits to his left, D.A. Ellis Loew to his right.  Seen earlier at the Mickey Cohen press conference, Loew is the only civilian.  Bud White stands across from them.  There to be judged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Officer White, you've refused to cooperate with Internal Affairs. But you should know this is bigger than a police board.  Indictments may be handed down.  Quite frankly, we need police witnesses to offset the damage done to the Department's image.  Will you testify? Bud glances to a gray tinted mirror, then to the Chief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.  I won't. The Chief sighs, looks to Loew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: District Attorney Loew. Loew steps to Bud, holds up a newspaper with the cell block photo.  The headline:  "BLOODY CHRISTMAS."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bloody Christmas.  The press love to label.  You and Officer Stensland brought the liquor into the precinct.  Stensland was already drunk.  Do you see how appearing as a voluntary witness against him could offset the damage you've done to yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't do it. (staring at mirror) I won't testify against my partner or anyone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man is a disgrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your badge and gun, Officer. Bud sets them on The Chief's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the new L.A.P.D., White. You're suspended from duty and dismissed. Turning, White shoots the mirror a stiff middle finger as he makes his way out.  Dudley Smith hides a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley watches, involuntarily leans back as Bud passes on the other side of the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley, Loew and The Chief wait as Exley enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, your observations have been astute.  What's your assessment of this situation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The public demands justice, sir. This was a full-fledged riot of policemen.  Shift the guilt to men whose pensions are secured.  Force them to retire.  But someone has to swing.  Indict, try and convict Stensland and Bud White.  Secure them jail time.  Feed them to the sharks, sir.  Protect yourself; protect the department. Dudley gives Exley a look.  He's angry with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stensland's a disgrace.  Straight D fitness reports from every C.O. he ever served under.  But White is a valuable officer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: White's a mindless thug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Edmund.  He's a man who can answer yes to those questions I ask you from time to time. The Chief interrupts with his own concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know who we give the public in contrast?  The department needs role models. Clean-cut, forthright men the public can admire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll testify, sir.  I'm not afraid to do what's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'll promote you.  You'll be a lieutenant immediately. Exley seizes the moment, going over Dudley's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Chief and Dudley exchange a look.  Neither approves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ed, you're 30.  Your father didn't make lieutenant until he was 33.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that, sir.  I also know that when he made lieutenant, it was as a detective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we start polishing our laurels, it would look better if we had a corroborative witness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'll be hard to come by.  The men hate a turncoat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack Vincennes.  He's the technical advisor on 'Badge of Honor,' sir.  He lives for it. That's the way to get him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Ed. (into desk intercom) Call Sergeant Vincennes. As Exley starts out, Dudley pulls him aside, speaks low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll reap the benefits, but are you truly prepared to be despised within the department?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Dudley.  I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So be it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking sharp, he strides down the hall, enters the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Round two.  Centred on Jack.  Exley is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sergeant, we'll get right to it. Nine civilian witnesses have identified you as hitting Ezekiel Garcia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But my office has a stellar witness who will tell the grand jury that you hit back only after being hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do I have to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Testify against the three officers who have already earned their pensions.  Our key witness will testify roundly, but you can plead ignorance to questions directed at the other men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll guarantee you a slap on the wrist.  A brief suspension followed by a temporary transfer from Narcotics to Ad Vice. (a beat) When you transfer out of Vice, you'll be back on the show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The show, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Badge of Honor, Vincennes.  We need to tone down your profile for a bit. The Chief just got Jack where he lives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, I doubt you've ever drawn a stupid breath.  Don't start now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  I'll do it. Smiles all around.  Loew smiles at the two-way.  A move not lost on Jack who wonders who might be on the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dismissed, Vincennes. Jack leaves.  The Chief steps to the mirror, looks through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So be it. Detective Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley clenches his fist in victory.  The Chief continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ace them at the grand jury tomorrow, son.  Wear the smart- looking suit and ace them.  And, Ed?  Lose the glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glasses off, Exley waits, looks up as Jack enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the key witness?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should've known.  What's the Chief throwing you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Exley.  What's the payoff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the payoff expert.  I'm just doing my duty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're playing an angle, college boy.  You're getting something out of this so you don't have to hobnob with the fucking rank and file cops who'll hate your guts for snitching.  If they're making you a detective, watch out.  Some Bureau guys are gonna burn in this and you're gonna have to work with friends of theirs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm snitching three old timers who'll be fishing in Oregon next week.  Next to you I'm clean.  And smart. At that, a CLERK steps in from the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edmund J. Exley to chambers. As Exley's about to go...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just remember, Bud White'll fuck you for this if it takes the rest of his life.  They already suspended him.  Just pray he cops a deal and stays on the Department because that is one civilian you do not want on your case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An old black guy in a frayed, threadbare tux plays piano. Bud, nursing a highball at the bar, steps over to a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with too much make-up on too many miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That an old fashioned you're drinking? (as she nods) My name's Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody was born with the name Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stick you with a name like Wendell, you look for an alias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you do, Bud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorta between jobs.  Look, what do you say we, uh... A hand on Bud's shoulder.  He turns to see Dudley Smith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lad, may I have a word with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This business, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say goodnight to your friend and join me by those back tables. Dudley starts off.  Bud turns back to Redhead, but she's already talking to a sailor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley sits at a table.  A newspaper is opened, a little mound underneath.  Bud joins Dudley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does that paper say we've been indicted?  Does it say Exley's a hero for squealing me and Stensland off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He made his play amd he got what he wanted.  They're making him a detective.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Dudley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley, what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lad, I admire your refusal to testify and your loyalty to your partner.  I admire you as a policeman, particularly your adherence to violence as a necessary adjutant to the job. And I am most impressed with your punishment of wife beaters.  Do you hate them, Wendell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I hate them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And for good reason judging from what I know of your background. Bud looks back over.  Dudley's getting too personal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going to happen to Stensland?  He'll give himself cirrhosis over this. He's one year from his pension .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would've happened years ago if you hadn't carried him.  Why the loyalty, Wendell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He helped me out once.  That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your partner's through. Department scapegoat on the Chief's orders.  He's been billed, he'll be indicted and he'll swing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Him and me both. Fucking Exley .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't underestimate his skills. As a politician he exceeds even myself.  But the department needs smart men like Exley and... direct men like yourself
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wendell, I want you to come to work for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doing what?  Mowing your fucking lawn? Smith yanks the newspaper revealing Bud's badge & .38 Special.  Bud can't believe his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're yours.  Take them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew you had juice, but... There's no goddamn bill on me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four of the defendants recanted their testimony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? Dudley dismisses the question with a wave of his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need you for an assignment the Chief's given me the go-ahead on. A duty few men are fit for, but you were born for.  You'll be working out of Homicide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Homicide?  A detective?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your talents lie elsewhere, Wendell.  It's a muscle job and shooting job.  You'll do what I say and not ask questions.  Do you follow my drift?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Technicolor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you work for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course... But how?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How what, Wendell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd you get them to retract? Dudley lays brass knuckles on the table.  They're chipped, caked with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : L.A. MONTAGE Over the pop song "STRANGER IN PARADISE." A)  EXT. GRAUMAN'S CHINESE - NIGHT Frank Sinatra at the premiere of From Here to Eternity . B)  INT. KLUB ZAMBOANGA - NIGHT Charlie "Bird" Parker makes magic before an appreciative, mostly black crowd. C)  TORCH SONG TAVERN (RIVERSIDE) - NIGHT Nate Janklow exits with his latest flame.  A mob lieutenant, Nate was last seen with Mickey Cohen outside the Federal Courthouse in the opening montage.  A CAR SCREECHES up.  TWO GUNS aim and Nate and his date do down in a proverbial HAIL OF LEAD. D)  EXT. FREEWAY - DAY A groundbreaking.  The Mayor scrapes at the ground with a gold shovel.  Pierce Patchett is among the distinguished guests. END OF MONTAGE EXT. HOLLYWOOD HIGH SCHOOL - DAY The marquee gushes:  "Today Sgt. Joe Reno:  Badge of Honor Star Brett Chase."

direction.raw_text: A nerdy 14-YEAR-OLD asks Brett Chase:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you become a policeman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a policeman.  I just play one on television.  But I think I can answer for them.  To help people.  That's why I do the show. Chase looks over and winks at Jack who waits in the wings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To protect and serve.  It's not just a motto. As the kids applaud, Chase joins Jack who gives him a quick drag of a cigarette.  A nervous PA joins them. Chase points out a fetching girl in the second row.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one.  In the sweater. (to Jack) They also serve who only stand and wait. Chase and Jack watch the PA ask "Sweater" a question while pointing to Chase.  Maybe sixteen, she nods "yes" eagerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, I'll see you Monday on set.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't be there.  They're toning down my profile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The latest issue of Hush-Hush flies through.  On the cover:  "Gail Russell Caught In Love Nest.  Nymph or No?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud White flips through today's booking slips, finds one that's interesting.  Reading to himself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Domestic.  Assault and battery. Containment Squad strong-arms, BREUNING and CARLISLE pause as they pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready to go, Bud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be there in five minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear you like to hit women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife.  She's dropping charges so it's none of your business. Bud enters, closes the door behind him.  A beat, we hear the sounds of FISTS ON FLESH.  It's Bud's business now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deuce Perkins (the Mickey Cohen narcotics lieutenant seen earlier) stands at the bookshelf.  He pulls down books to reveal a shoe box.  He sets it on his desk, pulls back the cover to reveal several bags of white powder. Heroin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: outside.  Perkins opens a drawer, fishes a revolver.  Turning off the light, he heads to the window. His finger parts the curtains.  At that instant, he staggers, falls as GUNFIRE rips into him. The heroin just sits there on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . McNEIL PENITENTIARY - DAY Grim-faced guards scan the yard from machine-gunned towers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . McNEIL PENITENTIARY - VISITOR BOOTH - DAY Mickey Cohen sits across from visitor Johnny Stompanato. Cohen is going off the handle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean Deuce Perkins got clipped last night?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They shot him in his library.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want a floor plan; I want to know who!  Who's taking the ticket for this, Johnny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody.  At least not yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what about the merchandise Deuce was holding for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gone.  Not a trace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some ferstunkener is moving in and we don't know who?!  Maybe we should ask Hedda Hopper! As "STRANGER IN PARADISE" ENDS, so does the MONTAGE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Addressing the squad, a no-nonsense VICE CAPTAIN picks up a stack of magazines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Picture-book smut, gentlemen. There's been a bunch of it found at collateral crime scenes lately. Mostly narcotics and prostitution collars. As the Vice Capt. hands it out for the men to examine, new member Jack Vincennes arrives late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look who's back from suspension. We're honored, Sergeant Jack. The men laugh.  Jack sits, flips a magazine.  Men and women.  Men and men.  Girls and girls.  Girls and horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee.  The Great Jerk-Off Book Caper of 1953.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vincennes, is there someplace you'd rather be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Cap.  Back in Narcotics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh?  Anyplace else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Working whores with squad two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you should have thought of that before you made Bloody Christmas page one. Vice Capt. retrieves the magazines, hands them to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're yours.  Make a major case, Sergeant.  It's the only way you're getting out of here. Exaggerated "oohs" and "aahs" from the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dismissed, gentlemen. As they go, Jack sees the books are stamped:  "Fleur-de-Lis Whatever you desire."  Jack takes the matching business card from his wallet, the one he found on Christmas Eve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roll, Vincennes.  No sidetracks. This is Ad Vice, not Narco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack Vincennes is at his desk.  Holding the Fleur-de-Lis card, magazines spread before him, Jack dials the number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid Hudgeons sits behind his desk, answers the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the Q.T.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid, it's Vincennes.

direction.raw_text: Jackie, are you back on Narco?  I need copy.

dialogue.raw_text: Hush-Hush .  Off the record and on

direction.raw_text: WITH Jack at his desk:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  But I've got something going with Ad Vice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know.  I'm chasing picture books.  Fuck shots, but the posers don't look like junkies.  It's well done stuff.  I thought you might have heard something. Hudgeons reaches into a stack of papers, pulls out a magazine like the one Jack has.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Fleur-de-Lis?  Their slogan's 'Whatever you desire.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  No, I've heard bupkis.  Jack, I'll talk to you later.  Call me when you get something I can use. Smut's from hunger.  For sad sacks who can't get their ashes hauled The LINE CLICKS off.  Jack hesitates a moment before cradling the receiver.  Something's not right here.

direction.raw_text: As Exley pulls in, his two-way drones:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Park Rangers report three Negro youths discharging shotguns into the air in Griffith Park. Suspects are driving a late model purple Mercury Coupe. As the report ends, Exley switches off the two-way and gets out of his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Accompanied by Bud, Dick Stensland crams the contents of his desk into a box.  Well-wishing cops pat him on the back, offer words of encouragement, but Stensland looks like he's going to cry. It's very bad timing as Exley enters, comes face-to-face with them.  This is hatred. Acting on impulse, Bud goes after Exley.  It's a mauling. Four vicious body shots.  A potentially lethal head shot sails wide as Exley falls to the ground. As four men move to hold Bud back, Exley looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just a thug, White.  That's all you'll ever be. Dudley steps into the fray.  He helps Exley to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should stay away from a man when his blood is up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His blood's always up. Four cops are genuinely having trouble holding Bud back. Dudley watches with something bordering on admiration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then maybe you should stay away from him all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Accompanied by Bud, Stensland reaches his car, loads his box of stuff into the trunk.  Bud is moody, pensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look so down in the mouth, Bud.  You nailed him good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, sure... I got a couple of hours before I have to be at the Victory.  Want to grab a beer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rain check me, partner.  I got something big going on tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  That new mystery girl you've been seeing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I'll tell you sometime.  Not now.  Don't want to jinx it.  But it could take the edge off that jail time I got coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's confidential, Bud.  Like that magazines Vincennes scams for. Hush-Hush . (smiles) I'll see you tomorrow.  And hey, if it works out, you'll get a piece of it. Stensland gets in the car, drives off.  Bud is left alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley sits alone in a sea of desks.  The SQUAWK BOX DRONES.  Exley squints at the clock on the wall, can't make it out.  He takes his glasses from the inside of his jacket.  2:00 A.M.  Finally, something to do.  He walks to the wall calendar, tears off Feb. 28 to reveal Mar. 1. As Exley sits, the call SQUAWK BOX booms to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squad call!  Nite Owl Coffee Shop One-eight-one-two-four Cherokee! Multiple homicides!  Multiple homicides!  Code three!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patrol cars.  Blues setting up a crime scene blockade. Exley pulls up, DOUSES his SIREN.  PATROLMAN #1 runs over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loads of people down.  Men. Women.  I stopped for coffee -- Exley pushes him aside, heads for the door.  It's wide open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley takes mental snapshots.  Ten stools front a counter.  The side wall mural-papered:  winking owls perched on street signs.  On the right a string of tables.  Three in disarray.  Food spilled, dishes broken. A high-heel pump by an upended chair. Heel drag marks across the linoleum floor heading back toward the kitchen.  Exley follows.  Past an open, empty cash register.  Outside -- SIRENS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crisscrossed drag marks connect, lead to a walk-in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood-soaked bodies on the floor.  Five, maybe six in a tangle.  Dozens of shotgun shells float in the pools of blood.  As Exley struggles to maintain his composure...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit fuck... Exley looks at a green-faced ROOKIE in the locker doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S-s-sir, there's a captain outside wants to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get sick!  Not in here! Exley shoves the Rookie, puking, out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Patrolmen hold back a swarm of reporters and rubber- neckers.  HORNS BLAST.  Motorcycles run interference for meat wagons cut off by the crown.  As Ed emerges, reporters surge, shout questions.  Exley hurries past, finds Dudley in command and barking orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I took the call.  It's my case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edmund, you don't want it and you can't have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's mine.  I'll make you my second in command. Exley spots a photographer moving in.  He looks properly serious as the flash bulb pops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forensics Chief RAY PINKER walks Exley and Dudley through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got a total of forty-five spent
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gauge Remington shotgun shells. Three men with five-shot-capacity pumps.  All of them reloading twice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on... We need to canvass. See if a purple Mercury was seen around here tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got a call earlier on three Negro youths.  Firing shotguns in Griffith Park from a late-model purple Mercury Coupe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches Pinker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'd called first, I wouldn't look this ridiculous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lynn comes to Bud naked, her hair brushed back.  Bud goes slow, gently, takes time with his kisses:  like she was a lonely woman he wanted to love to death. Lynn plays off his timing:  her kisses back, her touches. Finally, Bud forces himself to stop.  He pulls back so he can see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wondering if Patchett told me to be receptive. Bud doesn't answer, but yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter.  I like you, Bud.  I really do. She kisses him.  Softly, drawing it out.  Not a job.  She wants to make love to him.  And as Bud stops thinking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack sits in his car waiting.  He checks his watch...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :30.  Well past midnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Sid.  Where are you? Jack decides.  MOVE WITH him as he gets out and crosses the street.  The apartment is dark, the front door a few inches ajar.  Suspicious, Jack listens.  Dead quiet.  He enters...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one here it seems.  Till Jack nearly trips over a body.  Matt Reynolds.  Soaked in blood.  Throat slit. Jack looks down in horror as Reynolds seems to stare back up at him.  Jack stumbles out the door.  We hear his CAR DOOR SLAM shut, the SCREECH of RUBBER down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack pounds on Sid's door till lights switch on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Vincennes!  Open up! Hudgeons opens the door.  He's in his pajamas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackie!  You got some good scoop for the Sidster?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid, cut the crap.  I -- HUDGEONS Give me some Narco skinny.  I want to put out an all hop-head issue. Shvartze jazz musicians and movie stars.  Maybe tie it into the Rosenbergs.  You like? Jack grabs him, jerks him into the door frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, Trash?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened with the kid and Loew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't get my message?  It got called off.  The kid chickened out at the last minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dead.  I was just there. Somebody slit his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.  Jack, that's a story. 'Swish Actor Gets The Gay Blade.' Let me get my camera. Hudgeons starts away, but Jack grabs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loew didn't go with him.  You're sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I put Reynolds in the cab myself. The night cost me a hundred scoots and I got bupkis. Jack lets go of him, starts to ramble off into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackie!  Big V!  Let me get my camera!  Where are you going?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The BARTENDER walks down the bar to where Jack arrives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'll it be, Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bottle of Scotch. As the Bartender turns for one, the only bill Jack finds is the President Grant fifty.  The things he's done for fifty bucks... As he looks up with despair at his reflection in the bar mirror, the Bartneder sets down a bottle and shot glass.  He plucks the fifty from Jack's hand. Jack grabs the bottle and starts out.

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Your change!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spent, Bud and Lynn lie in bed.  SHe traces a finger over his bicep as he muses on the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who was that guy who was here earlier? Lynn's tracing finger stops on Bud's shoulder -- a small white scar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter.  All they get is Veronica Lake.  You got the real Lynn Margaret Bracken... (re: scar) Where'd this come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was ten, my old man threw a bottle at my mother.  I guess I got in the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you saved her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  But not for long. Bud looks away.  Lynn sees he doesn't want to talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you like being a cop, Bud?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to.  What I do now is strong-arm.  Sitting duck stuff... No, I don't like it.  If I could work Homicide like a real detective... Lynn listens sympathetically.  Bud's opening up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something wrong with the Nite Owl.  That prick Exley shot the wrong guys.  But they made him a hero and whoever killed my partner is still out there. Frustrated, Bud pokes at his own chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In here I know it.  But I can't prove it.  I'm not a detective. I'm not smart enough.  I'm just the guy they bring in to scare the other guy shitless. Bud looks away, embarrassed to have shown so much of himself.  Lynn reaches over, turns his face back to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You found Patchett.  You found me. You're smart enough.  Be a detective if that's what you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That simple, huh? Lynn nods.  That simple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley looks up as a CLERK enters holding two files.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got the rap sheets on the black guys, sir.  Coates and Jones got charges a mile long.  But except for some kid stuff, Fontaine's clean.

direction.raw_text: Clean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More or less.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until he gunned down six people.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked my men, Lieutenant.  No one remembers any colored guys firing shotguns.

direction.raw_text: Then who phoned in the report?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud White, what brings you down to the basement?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a few Nite Owl questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if you read the papers, but that case is closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm tying up loose ends.  Padding my report.  You know how it goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything off.  Anything that didn't make sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean beside the fact that thirty-five out of forty-five rounds were gratuitous?  I can't think of anything. Pinker is ticked as Bud steps over to where a group of Nite Owl crime scene photos are posted on the wall.  Bud pauses at a photo which shows the floor around the table. We see a high heel shoe, blood smears across the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whose shoe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susan Lefferts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she was sitting here, then it's facing the wrong way.  What are these smears in the blood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks like she was flailing, trying to get away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she's moving away from the door. (thinks; points) Who was sitting at this table?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dick Stensland. (a beat) Had to be dumb panic.  If she knew him she would've been sitting with him... Right? Bud wonders, maybe a puzzle piece just fell into place. Pinker remembers something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, there is one thing. Pinker rummages a shelf for a glass jar which he hands Bud.  Inside are two wax-saturated cotton balls.

direction.raw_text: Cotton balls.  I found them just inside the meat locker door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly.  At least one of those animals had the brains to protect his ears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't exactly play like dumb panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like they knew they were going to kill everyone before they went in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, so... Bud just stares at the picture of Susan Lefferts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A shingle shack dump.  Bud walks the front steps, RINGS the BELL.  Hilda Lefferts answers.  She doesn't look so good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Lefferts, I'm Officer White with the L.A.P.D.  I'd like to ask a couple of questions.

direction.raw_text: Let my daughter rest in peace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five minutes.  That's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pictures of Susan smile down from four walls.  Vamp poses on a nightclub floor.  Mrs. Lefferts is all twitchy and nervous, her eyes darting to a closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about the boyfriend she had.  The one you mentioned at the morgue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First I want to go on record as saying that my Susie was a virgin when she died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am, I'm sure she was. Mrs. Lefferts talks directly to a photo of her daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Susie, I told you I didn't approve of that boyfriend.  He was too old for you.  You let him come into this house and be fresh to me.  I went out one day and old Mrs. Jensen next door saw Susan's boyfriend and another man and thought she heard a ruckus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that boyfriend's name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were never properly introduced. Susan and I were fighting that day.  She called him by a nickname.  Muns or Lunts or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stens?  Was it Stens?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe.  I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at a picture for me. Bud hands her a snapshot of Stensland taken in Tijuana. Out of uniform.  She recognizes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's him.  That's him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said a neighbor heard a ruckus.  Was it outside, inside? Mrs. Lefferts' eyes go crazy, darting to a closed door. Rolled towels are crammed against the bottom of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  You'll have to leave now, Officer. Bud starts for the closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's through here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  Please leave! Bud kicks away the towels, opens the door, steps into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Innocuous except for the smell.  It hits Bud right off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't mind the smell.  I think a rat died behind the wall... My Susie was a good girl!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy.  Tell me about the ruckus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came home that night and there was blood on the floor.  Susan said Stams -- Stens had cut himself.  They were acting nervous.  And that Stens kept going under the house. As Mrs. Lefferts goes shrill, Bud beelines out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holding a flashlight, Bud crawls under the house, into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud elbow-crawls over the dirt, between wooden pilings. There's a long burlap sack ahead.  It smells bad.  Bud rips burlap.  A rat's nest explodes.  Bud sweeps a forearm at them.  As they clear, he sees a gristle-caked human skull staring back, a .38 hole in the forehead. Undaunted, Bud tears the burlap back further.  He pats the corpse's pockets, comes up with a wallet.  Bud checks the ID.  "Turner Meeks."  Bus knows him by that name and another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buzz Meeks... Holy shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud crawls out, blinking sunlight and gulping fresh air. Mrs. Lefferts is there.  She's scared.

direction.raw_text: Was it... a rat?

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  A great big one. Bud opens Meeks' wallet, pulls out a couple hundred bucks and gives them to Mrs. Lefferts.

direction.raw_text: Here.  Compliments of the Los Angeles Police Department.

direction.raw_text: Hey, just in time for our stomach of the week.  Frankfurters with sauerkraut, French fries, Coca-Cola, alcohol and sperm. Jesus, what a last supper. The stiff is Matt Reynolds!  Pinker continues working away.

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?

direction.raw_text: Bud White grilled me on it this morning.  You know, he's not as dumb as I thought. As Exley's head swims...

direction.raw_text: Let my Susie rest in peace!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Lefferts, I just want to ask a few questions.

direction.raw_text: Officer White?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sweet man.

direction.raw_text: Under the house.

direction.raw_text: All he found were rodents.  No signs of foul play.  So there. Exley spots the entrance to the crawlspace.  He hurries over, enters nearly flat on his belly.  Mrs. Lefferts calls in after him.

direction.raw_text: My daughter was a virgin!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't doubt it -- Oh, God.

direction.raw_text: Jack sits unshaven and hung-over, the dregs of the Scotch bottle on the desk.  He considers a framed "Badge of Honor" photo:  Jack and Brett Chase, before a banner "To Protect and Serve."  Jack punches a fist through it.

direction.raw_text: I need an I.D. ASAP.  You talk only to me on this one.

direction.raw_text: Sitting in disgust, Jack spots something amidst all the clutter -- the Great Jerk-Off Books of 1962.  He flips one over, looks at the Fleur-de-Lis stamp.  Jack remembers something Matt Reynolds told him.  He dials the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Sergeant Jack Vincennes requesting.  I need the home address on a Pierce Patchett.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please hold, Sergeant... As Jack waits, Exley appears in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to speak to you.

direction.raw_text: Give me a minute, will ya? Exley clicks off the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damnit... What ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to follow Bud White.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even I'm not that crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a request.  I need to know what White knows.  Follow him or I'll have you pulled off 'Badge of Honor.'  Permanently.

direction.raw_text: Yesterday that might've meant something.  Pull me off.  You'd be doing me a big favor.

direction.raw_text: Yesterday yes, today no.  What happened last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Transfer me, suspend me.  Just leave me alone.

direction.raw_text: You make a mistake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  My whole life. Jack stands, heads out.  Exley follows; he needs help.

direction.raw_text: Listen, I think I made a mistake, too.

direction.raw_text: I ain't a priest, Lieutenant.  I can't hear your confession.

direction.raw_text: Do you make the three Negroes for the Nite Owl killings?

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a simple question.

direction.raw_text: You should be the last person who wants to dig any deeper into the Nite Owl, Lieutenant . Exley watches as Jack continues down a hall.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rollo Tomasi. Jack stops, looks back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there more to that, or do I have to guess?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rollo was a purse snatcher.  My father ran into him off duty.  He shot my father six times and got away clean.  No one even knew who he was.  I made the name up to give him some personality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's the point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rollo's the reason I became a cop. I wanted to catch the guys who thought they could get away with it.  It was supposed to be about truth and justice and Rollo.  But somewhere along the way I forgot all that... How about you, Jack? Why'd you become a cop? Jack looks like he might cry, but smiles instead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't remember... Both men are quiet a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to figure what angle you're playing this time, but I sure as hell can't see one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've given up angles for awhile. I just want to solve this thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Nite Owl was solved, Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to do it right. So does Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, college boy, I'll help you. But I want half the collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A third.  I don't think we can make a case without Bud White.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Packard pulls up out front.  Bud gets out, heads inside.  Another car pulls up across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching Bud.  Jack gets out, starts across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the bar, Johnny Stompanato looks over as Bud joins him.  Stompanato isn't happy about it, but he smiles anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wendell White, how's tricks, paesano ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't your paesano , you wop cocksucker. Nervous, Johnny taps his pinkie ring on a bottle of beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want, officer ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember an ex-cop named Buzz Meeks?  He works for a guy named Patchett. Johnny taps his ring harder.  The bottle almost tips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His file listed you as a known associate.  Now spill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah.  That was a long time ago.  Before your day.  The last few years he's been muscle for hire.  But I heard he's disappeared.

direction.raw_text: More.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More's gonna cost you. Bud's hand flashes out, grabs Stompanato by the crotch.

direction.raw_text: How 'bout I give you your balls back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before Meeks disappeared he was popping off about trying to move eighteen pounds of heroin.

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.  Where would a two-bit ex-cop get 18 pounds of heroin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deuce Perkins.  Mickey C's narcotics lieutenant.  The night he got clipped, eighteen pounds of Mickey's heroin went missing. Bud loosens his grip.  Stompanato gasps for air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack peels in, catches a glimpse of Bud and Stompanato. Too far away too hear anything, Jack quickly ducks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stompanato's recovering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meeks is probably in Rio or someplace like that by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's under a tract house in San Berdoo.  And he don't smell too good.  What happened to the heroin, Johnny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  I swear it! Bud starts to raise a hand.  Stompanato cringes, but Bud just slaps a twenty down on the bar and goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack's on the phone to Exley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's in the Brown Derby with Johnny Stompanato. (sees Bud exit) Check that.  I gotta go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack pulls up, sees Bud knock on the front door.  It opens and Bud steps in.  Jack doesn't see who opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  There's movement in the underbrush.  Jack appears, followed by Exley.  Jack pulls a gun as they near a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud White.  He sees us and we're dead. They press up to the glass for a partial view.  Bud White sits on a footstool massaging a pair of women's feet. Jack and Exley exchange a long, curious look.  This isn't the Bud White they're used to.  A pair of woman's hands take Bud, the arms covered in glitter and satin. The woman, Lynn Bracken, leans forward to kiss her policeman.  It may have been a long day, but she's every inch Veronica Lake.  Only the hair's not over her eye. They stand, kiss again.  Lynn's gown spills down around her ankles.  Bud scoops Lynn into his arms and the two of them disappear into a bedroom.  A long beat before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus... Maybe White's not so dumb after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rita Hayworth at the morgue and now Veronica Lake with White. What the hell's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Movie star hookers.  Whatever you desire... It's Fleur-fr-Lis again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's Fleur-de-Lis?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: High line whores.  With plastic surgery to look like movie stars. And who knows what else?  It's run by this guy Pierce Patchett.  You want to talk to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  But first I want to brace Stompanato.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley and Jack enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check the bar.  I got the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley scans.  There's Stompanato with a girl who looks amazingly like "LANA TURNER." Engrossed, Stomapanato doesn't look up till Exley's nearly on top of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you want an autograph, write to M-G-M.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when do two-bit hoods and hookers give out autographs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Stompanato stands, Exley flashes his badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A.P.D.  Sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who in the hell do you think you are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a walk, honey, before I haul your ass downtown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are making a large mistake. As Jack arrives, Lana tosses a drink in Exley's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from our table!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up.  Being cut to look like Lana Turner doesn't mean you are Lana Turner. Jack pulls him aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is Lana Turner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is Lana Turner.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who in the hell do you think are ?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Rolling.  The sky glows ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was I supposed to know? A moment before Jack begins to laugh.  Exley joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley's Plymouth is parked on the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a silk robe, the unflappable Pierce Patchett smiles at Exley.  Jack stands alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe the Nite Owl's your area of expertise, Mr. Exley.  I saw you on television getting your medal. (turns to Jack) And you're that other celebrity Hollywood policeman, aren't you? A beat.  Exley and Jack don't look like they appreciate being joked with.  Patchett finally sighs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you what I told Officer White when he asked me about Susan's death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud White's been here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the last time.  I may suborn women into illicit activities, but they're handsomely compensated, I treat them well and make sure the men they deal with show them every due respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the Veronica Lake look-alike one of your whores?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vulgar term, but yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's her name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lynn Bracken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's she seeing Bud White?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do men and women usually see each other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything else you want to add before I talk to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not good enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then try talking to my lawyer. Good evening, gentlemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley and Jack head for the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy's as cool as they come. A call CRACKLES in over Exley's RADIO.  Exley picks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Exley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray Pinker wants to talk to you, Lieutenant.  Says he has your I.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay.  These are police. (as she leaves) What do you want?
