direction.raw_text: I want D.A. bureau men to tail Dudley Smith twenty-four hours a day; I want you to get a judge to authorize a wire tap on his home phone; I want authorization to check his bank records and I want it all in an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On what evidence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None.  Call it a hunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely not.  Dudley Smith is a highly decorated member of this city's police department and I won't smear his name without -- EXLEY Without what, his smearing yours first?  What's he got on you, Loew?  Pictures of you and an out of work actor with your pants down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have any proof?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The proof had his throat slit. (a beat) So far you're not denying it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to dignify youwith answers.  If you'll excuse me, I've got a Jack Vincennes press conference to prepare for. Loew enters his bathroom.  Bud looks to Exley who nods: Go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loew is at the mirror clipping a few stray nose hairs. Bud enters full of menace followed by Exley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless you're here to wipe my ass, I think we're through. Bud just glares at him.  Loew shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't try this good cop/bad cop with me.  I practically invented it.  And so what if some homo actor is dead.  Boys, girls, ten of them step off the bus to L.A. every day. The MIRROR SPIDERWEBS as Bud slams Loew's face into it. Bud swings him around, forces him forward and shoves his head in the toilet. He holds it there, finally lets Loew up for breath.  Then backhands:  one, two, three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley Smith.  Spill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call him off, Exley!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know how. More backhands.  Holding Loew by the scruff of the neck, Bud marches him past Exley and back into the...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud heaves up the window, practically throws Loew through it.  Loew catches hold of the window framing.  Bud hammers his hands loose with a fist and pushes him through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud holds his leg.  Loew screams as coins, comb and wallet spill from his pockets, plummet toward the street below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud shakes Loew, could drop him at any time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I let you go, there'll be ten more lawyers to take your place tomorrow.  They just won't come on the bus, that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear Loew's PANT LEG TEARING loose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay!  You're right!  Dudley's got photos of me and Reynolds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's Dudley's scheme? More TEARING.  Loew's life may depend on the answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley's rotten to the core.  He's taking over Mickey Cohen's rackets, his own hand-picked cops'll be the new franchise holders.  Because of those pictures I won't be able to prosecute.  Oh Jesus pull me up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley helps pull Loew back inside.  Bud dumps him on the floor.  Bruised and bloodied, Loew looks up at Exley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley's got everyone under his thumb.  Not just me, but the Chief of Police, the lieutenant governor, everybody! Exley pulls his .38, shoves it into the side of Loew's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and Officer White visits you alone next time. Loew looks at Bud, nods, his face a bloody mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley and Bud exit.  Bud's wheels are turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They never made a match on the shotgun serial numbers.  What if Breuning and Carlisle took them from the evidence room?  Couple of cold pieces that had been hanging around a year or two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should check the records, and, we should talk to Lynn. Bud just stares at him a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to talk to her? Bud looks away, shakes his head "no."  Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do it.  I'll check the files.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lynn looks up as Exley enters.  her face is puffy, swollen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I knew you were coming I'd have baked a cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget everything else for a second, Lynn.  Is there anything you can give me on Dudley Smith? A blank look from her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A police captain.  I think he's behind all of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I work for Patchett.  I had a feeling that there was someone else, but I never knew who.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Look, if it helps, Bud hates himself for what he did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how he feels. A beat as Exley wonders how he should interpret this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if it's pathetic or romantic, but when this is all over I'd like to see you again. Lynn looks away, can't help an ironic smile even as she starts to cry.  As Exley gives her his handkerchief...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud waits at the cage window as a RECORDER returns with some information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got your guns, Bud.  Signed in April 3rd, 1950.  Remember the First Western bank robbery?  They were used in that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to see them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No can do.  I can't find them. As Bud thinks, a ROOKIE-TYPE approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh -- Sergeant White?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dispatch just got a call for you. Lieutenant Exley wants you to meet him at the Victory Motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud's Packard crests the rise looking down on the Victory.  Exley's Plymouth is in the courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley in the hotseat.  Sitting there thinking.  At a CAR DOOR CLOSING, he goes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley opens the door as Bud approaches, toting a shotgun. The sun is down.  The sky is just a dull glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to meet here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?  You called it.  I got a message that... As the reality sinks in, Bud and Exley hear TIRES on the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; CARS are COMING.  Being in a concavity, they don't see them yet.  Then the CARS STOP.   But still Bud and Exley can't see anything.  They hear the CLICKS of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: but they don't hear them shut.  There are FOOTSTEPS, MURMURED WHISPERS.  More CARS PULL UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit... Come on. Exley starts for his car, but Bud holds him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. A beat.  Resigned, Exley nods.  They retreat back to Room
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: disappear inside.  A beat.  There's MOVEMENT in the shadows to the left.  To the right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a big back window.  Bud covers most of it with a ratty old mattress.  He pumps the shotgun. He pulls a .45 automatic from his waistband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. He throws the auto to Exley, pulls out a .38.  Bud's armed for bear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You figured this was a set-up? And you showed up anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lot of bad stuff happened here. It's as good a place as any for it to end. Bud switches off the light.  They wait in silence.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, all I ever wanted was to measure up to my father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I spent years trying not to live down to mine. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should block off the bathroom. They could come through -- A CREAK outside the front door.  Bud levels the SHOTGUN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  The DOOR is BLOWN OFF ITS HINGES.  We see the figure of a man sprawl back in the dirt.  In the darkness beyond, MUZZLE FLASHES from all around.  Exley and Bud
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We hear the BACK WINDOW BREAK under a MUFFLED BLOW.  Bud charges back, yanks down the mattress revealing two men climbing through.  Sitting ducks:  torn apart by THREE TRIPLE-AUGHT ROUNDS close in.  A beat, then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got him! Bud smiles, in on the plan as theres an answering WHOOP. A third man looks through the window.  BOOM!  Bud nails him. Bud motions Exley to stay put, then slips out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud crouches, looks between the cinder blocks supporting the room.  Two sets of feet shuffling along.  Bud FIRES the SHOTGUN.  Shrieks as the men go down.  Bud extends the .38 to fire point blank headshots.  Then... Bud flattens himself as a wicked CROSSFIRE TEARS UP ROOM 6.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exley is forced down as well, lying flat as plaster rains down. The door frame splinters as more Dudley men charge in. Four men with rifles.  One is Patchett's Burly Bodyguard. They spot Exley lying there.  Hushed whispers as they approach:  "Dead meat."  "Be careful."  Kicks in the side.  The men look at each other, sneer. Exley jerks a foot.  The foot man stumbles as Exley spins around SHOOTING.  FIRING the .45 and his own .38.  All four men go down.  Exley stands, digs into his pocket to reload. Bud scrambles back through the window.  Exley looks over and smiles as Bud reloads the shotgun.  It's dead quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking we might walk away from this. At that instant, Dudley steps through the bathroom door. He's got Exley dead to rights.  As he squeezes the trigger, Bud leaps forward, pushes Exley hard to the ground. The SHOT passes through Bud's back by his left shoulder blade.  It spins him around.  A SECOND SHOT to the stomach slows him to a walk as he charges Dudley.  A THIRD ROUND SHATTERS Bud's jaw, but still he comes. Driven by rage, his hands reaching for Dudley's throat. He even gets hold before a FOURTH SLUG tears his chest. Bud falls hard. Dudley swings his aim to Exley who's just managed to shake the cobwebs of being flattened by Bud.  A frozen moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm loathe to kill my brother officers, Edmund.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell that to Jack Vincennes.  To Stensland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack was a shame, but Dick Stensland had the audacity to try to sell me my own heroin.  Through his whore girl friend.  I sent him to make the buy.  The rest is history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vacuum, Edmund.  That's what we have in Los Angeles.  Sending Mickey Cohen up created it.  My containment work maintained it. Certain photographs guarantee it. Organized crime has been held back, but there's still a demand for the services it provides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now you'll provide them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely.  Prostitution and gambling are victimless crimes. The heroin we'll run down to the coloreds.  Anesthetize them.  As long as it's not a middle class problem, no one will care.  It's still a crime free city... for respectable people. Dudley aims the .38, cocks back the hammer.  We hear
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't politics, Edmund. There won't be winners and losers when it's over... Dudley doesn't see Bud stir, reach into a pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the living and the dead. It's always been that way in the Bureau.  You should've realized that before you became a detective. It's over.  Dudley's finger tightens on the trigger.  But Dudley screams as Bud buries a switchblade into his left calf.  It took all Bud had left.  As he collapses... Dudley wails; Exley dives for Bud's shotgun.  Dudley
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: misses.  A wild SHOTGUN BLAST takes out half the wall.  Dudley stumbles out the door.  SIRENS BLARE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley drops his gun as the cruisers stream down.  Exley steps out behind him, but doesn't drop the shotgun.  The two of them are bleached white by headlights. Dudley raises his badge over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're policemen! (winks) Let me do the talking.  They'll make you Chief of Detectives. Exley steps ahead to block his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not, lad?  Absolute justice?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rig crime scene evidence to support a prosecuting attorney's working hypothesis? Exley doesn't answer.  Dudley smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be willing to beat confessions out of suspects you knew to be guilty? Exley glares.  Laughing, Dudley brushes by, limps toward the gathering policemen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you willing to shoot hardened criminals in the back to offset the chance they'll -- The SHOTGUN BELCHES flame.  Dudley goes down, shot in the back.  Exley drops the gun, raises his hands over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : L.A. MONTAGE "RAGS TO RICHES" PLAYS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Really ?  Would you be willing to
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Riding in a convertible, waving to the crowds is the Grand Marshal -- the new Vice President, a young Richard Nixon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A midnight assembly.  The Chief, D.A. Loew and several high ranking brass.  Their attention riveted
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the one-way glass into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 - NIGHT Bloody, exhausted, Exley sits across from two INTERNAL AFFAIRS DETECTIVES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a lot of explaining to do, Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I do. As Exley begins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where we're informed that tonight's episode of "Badge of Honor" is:  "Dedicated to the memory of technical advisor Sergeant Jack Vincennes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A ribbon is cut.  Eager motorists roll down the blacktop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ronald Reagan applauds as Jane Wyman plunges her hands into fresh sidewalk cement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The brass exchange concerned looks and raied eyebrows as they watch Exley THROUGH the glass, his VOICE heard OVER the SPEAKERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Flatnose Frisco loan shark and Cauliflowered Cleveland enforcer seen earlier at the Victory Motel return to L.A., ready to fill the vacuum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush-Hush is delivered.  The headline:  "Actor Reynolds in his Final Role:  Conductor of the Night Train to Slice City."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 - NIGHT Exley stares across at the Internal Affairs Detectives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it.  That's the whole story. As Exley looks to the gray-tinted wall mirror...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Loew leans over, whispers to the Chief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The press would have a field day with this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When in doubt, feed them a hero. In this case, we'll need more than one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : LOS ANGELES EXAMINER HEADLINE: R.I.P. DUDLEY SMITH Fabled L.A. Cop Dies Defending City from Organized Crime!
direction.name: direction
